en: [fade_in]We will never make a real call.[/fade_in]
[fade_in]You will use your voice to answer questions,[/fade_in]
You will use your voice to answer questions, [fade_in]but we will never save your voice.[/fade_in]
[fade_in]When you call 000, you can follow three steps to find an interpreter in your language.[/fade_in]
How to ask for an interpreter
How to say where you are in English

YOU ANSWER:

[fade_in][url={1}]'Police'[/url]ğŸ”‰, [url={2}]'Fire'[/url]ğŸ”‰, or [url={3}]'Ambulance'[/url]ğŸ”‰.

Say only one service in English.[/fade_in]

000 ASKS:

[fade_in][url={2}]'What is the state and town of your emergency?'[/url]ğŸ”‰[/fade_in]

YOU ANSWER:

[fade_in]The area and state of your emergency.

eg: [url={4}]'Dandenong, Victoria'[/url]ğŸ”‰

eg: [url={5}]'Mildura, Victoria'[/url]ğŸ”‰[/fade_in]
[fade_in]Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.[/fade_in]

Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.

[fade_in]When you are connected they will ask you for the address of your emergency.[/fade_in]

Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.

[fade_in]This is a good time to ask for an interpreter.[/fade_in]
